channel.title: Forecasting on Data Science Explorer
channel.description: Recent content in Forecasting on Data Science Explorer

item.title: Forecasting AFL Mean Score
item.description: Today I practice some time-series forecasting techniques in R by applying them to total scores in the AFL. The question I am interested in answering is - “what kind of average scores should we expect in AFL over next 10 years” Here are the packages used; # Packages library(tidyverse) # For everything ## Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 3.5.1 library(here) # For project-oriented workflow library(ggthemes) # For nice plot themes library(forecast) # For nice plot themes library(devtools) # For non-CRAN packages library(fitzRoy) # Data source Set up and EDA I create a data set for simple time-series analysis.

item.title: Time Series Forecasting Practice
item.description: Today I explore time series forecasting use AFL data from the fitzRoy package. Key concepts A forecast is the mean of simulated futures. Making a ts object Trend, Seasonality, Cyclicity Plotting lags and ACF White noise Creating forecast objects Checking residuals Mean Absolute Scaled Error Cross Validation Exponential Smoothing Things to do # TODO - figure out why full ts doesn't show info from the 1900s # Packages library(tidyverse) # For everything ## Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 3.
